content:
Eight girls attended the school. They were using the same umbrella. Why did none of the females get wet?
1. The umbrella that the girls were sharing was exceptionally large or had a wide canopy.
2. Because it was not raining.
3. The eight girls could have been sharing the umbrella at different times or taking turns using it.

The tennis match involved two men. Each man won three sets in the five that were played. How is this even conceivable?
1. The two men were partners playing doubles.
2. They followed a round-robin format, where each player competes against every other player in the tournament.
3. TUmNioAvy4g4yjtpm7NddBi9chAAB9RUep

When John, a young child, told his parents he intended to shoot and blow up people, they were shocked. His parents were really happy with his professional decision. Remember, his parents weren't exactly aggressive folks. Why?
1. The parents known John was kiding and didn't pay attention.
2. John wants to be a video game designer  and his parent are addicted to vedio gams.
3. John wanted to be a photographer.

A man who resided on the twenty-story building's top floor had to travel up and down each day for work, as well as for food and other requirements. He could only use the elevator up to the fifteenth story most days, after which he had to continue walking. However, he could ride all the way to the twentieth storey when it poured. Why?
1. The building had a system in place where, during rainy conditions, certain residents were granted exclusive access to the higher floors. 
2. The man wasn't tall enough to reach the button for the 20th floor. He could only reach the 15th story button on the elevator. When it rained, he brought his umbrella, and used it to press the 20th story button on the elevator.
3. During rainy weather, the elevator was programmed to automatically bypass certain floors above the fifteenth story.

In front of an old saloon, a horse is chained to a five-meter rope. Hay bale is ten meters behind the horse. The horse can eat the hay whenever he wants without severing his rope. How is that even possible?
1. The walls of the saloon retract or collapse inwards, creating more space for the horse to reach the hay.
2. The rope is not tied to anything else.
3. The rope stretches proportionally, providing the extra length needed for the horse to reach the hay ten meters away.

An individual shoots their spouse. She continues by keeping him submerged for over five minutes. She hangs him finally. However, they go out together and have a fantastic supper five minutes later. Why is this the case?
1. The woman gets arrested for murder after dinner.
2. The woman was a photographer. She shot a picture of her husband, developed it, and hung it up to dry.
3. The woman gets a new partner.

Rain began to fall as Samuel was taking a stroll. He wasn't wearing a hat, and he didn't have an umbrella. Even though his clothes were completely drenched, not a single hair on his head was moist. How is this even possible?
1. His hair is dyed.

2. This man walk upside down to avoid rain.
3. This man is bald.

Natives of the Arctic will never eat a penguin's egg, not even if they are starving. Exactly why not?
1. Penguins only live in Antarctica.
2. Penguins' eggs are toxic.
3. Penguins and their eggs are not part of their traditional or cultural diet.

There was once a bad wizard. He abducted three women from their homes and transformed them into identical rose plants. They were placed in his garden. One of the women pleaded with the magician to allow her to see her husband and kids. He concurred. He took the woman to her home at night. He arrived early in the morning and drove her home. The spouse made the decision to go get her one day. He entered the wizard's garden as a result. He kept glancing at the three identical rose bushes, trying to determine which one might be his wife. He took his wife home as soon as he realized the solution. How did he recognize his wife among the rosebushes?
1. The husband knew which rose bush was his wife because it was the only one that still had her distinctive scent.
2. The wizard brought the rosebush to her home at night and returned her to the garden in the morning. Therefore, she was the only plant without dew.
3. The husband knew which rose bush was his wife because it was the only one that leaned towards him as he approached

Despite sharing the same parents, the 22nd and 24th presidents of the United States of America were not related. How is this even conceivable?
1. Their parents got divorced.
2. The 24th president has better performance during tenure.
3. They were the same man.

The six daughters of Mr. and Mrs. Mustard each have one brother. However, the family only consists of nine people; how is that possible?
1. Some daughters get married and have their own family.
2. Some brothers were not loved by family and moved away.
3. Each daughter shares the same brother.

After moving into a new home, a man decided that he was exhausted from the trip and turned out all the lights before retiring to bed. He did not sleepwalk the night before he killed 365 people; instead, he slept soundly. How is this possible?
1. He lived in a light house.
2. The man is a world-renowned botanist who has just moved into a new house with a rare greenhouse containing 365 unique and endangered plant species.
3. The man could be a calendar maker. He accidentally excluding February 29th on a leap year's calendar. This "killed" the day for 365 people.

There are five apples in a basket. You distribute them among the five girls, giving each one an apple while leaving one apple in the basket. How is that even doable?
1. Two girls decide to share one apple.
2. Give the fifth girl her apple in the basket.
3. One girl is polite and return her apple back.

Tom was arguing with his younger sister. Because of the fighting, their mother decided to have them stand on the same piece of newspaper so they couldn't touch each other as punishment. How did she manage to do this?
1. Tom and his younger sister stand on the newspaper back-to-back.
2. The newspaper was folded multiple times and ended with a special shape.
3. Tom's mother slid a newspaper under a door, each sibling standing on each side.

A town that has been painted black has a black dog standing in the midst of an intersection. Due to a storm-related power outage, none of the street lights are functioning. When a car with two broken headlights approaches the dog, it turns away in time to miss him. How was the dog able to be seen by the driver in time?
1. The broken headlights can emit a small amount of light, even if it's dim. 
2. The driver could have relied on their sense of hearing to detect the presence of the dog.
3. It was during the daylight hours.

A common peasant recently purchased many camels and is transporting them to his land. He counts them as he travels happily and finds that there are 29 of them. He leaps off his camel in fright after thinking he had purchased 30 camels and counts them once more. He is delighted to find 30. He counts his camels again thirty minutes later, and this time there are only 29. He dismounts his camel in confusion and counts once more. There are 30 once more. Can you elaborate?
1. One camel had moved away from the group when the peasant was counting.
2. The peasant is mistakenly considering himself as one of the camels when he counts them.
3. When he is on the camel he omits to count it.

There are 3 apples available for 2 fathers and 2 boys to consume. They each receive a single apple. How is it a mathematical possibility?
1. Two sons shared the same apple.
2. One father gave his apple to his son.
3. They are one son, one father and one grandfather.

One evening, Joe and Sally were relaxing in their family room. Sally, Joe's wife, was reading while he was watching television. The moment the electricity went out, Joe made the decision to retire to bed, but Sally continued to read. Sally carried on reading without using any artificial lighting. How?
1. Sally is smart that she pretended to reading the book.
2. Sally was blind, she was reading a book by Braille.
3. Because it was daytime.

The ship was in the harbor on a beautiful sunny day. The ship suddenly started to sink. The ship sank in front of the onlookers despite there being no storm or mechanical issue. What led to the ship's sinking?
1. There are too many spectators in the harbor.
2. There are too many fish around the ship.
3. It was a Submarine.

Brad began by entering the office tower's 22nd story through the filthy common window. He slid the window open and leapt through it after becoming depressed. Outside the building, there was a cliff-like drop to the ground. Amazingly, he came to rest entirely unharmed. How could he have survived the fall if there was nothing to slow or cushion his descent?
1. Brad was so sick and tired of window washing, he opened the window and jumped inside.
2. The ground outside the building is wet.
3. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.

A car accident involving a father and son resulted in the death of the father. The son was transported to the hospital by ambulance. He required surgery right away. A doctor entered the operating room and said, "I can't operate on him. He's my son." after taking one look at the young patient. Why?
1. The son has two fathers.
2. Because the doctor is the mother of the son.
3. The son calls the police for help to save his father.

Five men were traveling down a road when it began to rain. Four of the guys sped up, but the fifth did not, but they all reached at the same location at the same time, and all but the fifth were wet. How is that even doable?
1. The 5th man beated them at the end.
2. The 5th man walked slowly to dodge the raining.
3. He was dead and in a coffin.

Although Dorothy has never stated suicide ideas, whenever she feels down or depressed, she makes plans to go to a very high location that she has frequented before. Once there, she makes the decision to jump from the enormous height. The amazing thing is that she has never experienced an injury as a result of her leap, and she even claims to feel much better afterwards. What is going on here, and why has she never been hurt or, worse still, killed as a result of her dangerous behavior, if she isn't suicidal?
1. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.
2. Dorothy is a sky jumper.
3. Dprpyju was just raving to show her is outstanding.

A small motorboat with three men inside is parked one meter from the shore. The first fears being submerged in water, the second fears drowning, and the third fears sharks. There is nothing to row with and the boat's motor is not working. How do they reach the coast?
1. They can wait until water level is high enough, they can safely step out onto the shoreline. 
2. They can just walk onto its as the boat is one-meter inland.
3. 
They can wait until the water evaporates completely.

A boat on the lake included four men. All four men on the boat sink to the bottom of the lake when it flips over. However, not a single man gets wet! Why?
1. Because they were all married and not single.
2. Despite the boat turning over and sinking, the water level was not high enough to reach the men's bodies.
3. The lake was frozen, none of the men got wet despite sinking to the bottom.

A train is approaching a man who is strolling down a railroad track quickly. He charges directly at the train for roughly 10 feet before finally jumping off the track instead of doing so right away. Why?
1. By moving towards the train momentarily, the man minimizes the risk of being hit directly by the front of the train.
2. By moving towards the oncoming train, the man's brain interprets the change in distance and relative motion as a decrease in speed.
3. The man was on a bridge when he first saw the train so he couldn't jump off the track immediately.

Despite the fact that the entire flight was lost in a plane crash and each single person is killed, there were survivors. Describe how?
1. The married people lived and the singles died.
2. The survivors could refer to individuals who were not on the plane.
3. Some people died later.

All but one of Mrs. Smith's pets are dogs, and all but one are cats. But how is it possible that Mrs. Smith only has two pets?
1. Mrs.Smith has one additional pet that is neither a dog or a cat.
2. Mrs.Smith has one hybrid pet that is a dog and a cat at the same time.
3. Mrs. Smith has one cat and one dog.

How was it possible for a cowboy to arrive in town on Friday, stay for two days, and leave on Wednesday?
1. His horse is named Wednesday.
2. While in town, he stays in bed for two days.
3. Friday and Saturday are holidays.

Every day, a horse covers a particular distance. Strangely, two of its legs cover 30 miles daily while the other two cover about 31 miles. Given that the horse is typical, it would seem that two of its legs must be a mile ahead of the other two. However, this is obviously not the case. How is that even possible?
1. Because the Earth is not a perfect sphere.
2. The horse operates a mill and travels in a circular clockwise direction. The two outside legs will travel a greater distance than the two inside legs.
3. The measurements are taken from different reference points.

One woman placed a quick delivery pizza order, and it was delivered the following year. How is that even possible?
1. The courier got lost and spent the whole year to find the way.
2. She ordered the pizza for New Year's Day.
3. The pizza store was out of ingredients.

Three doors are present. Every door has a way to exit. The first door has lava and fire inside. Lions behind the second door haven't eaten in five years. There is a 1,000-foot drop into an alligator inside the third door. Which door will you probably get through?
1. The first door, the first door is destroyed and you can see the fire in it.
2. The second door with the lions. Since they haven't eaten in 5 years they will have died.
3. The third door, the alligator can be tierd and won't eat people.

A five-pound steel ball will fall through water at 40 degrees Fahrenheit more quickly than water at 20 degrees Fahrenheit if it is dropped from a height of 45 inches in Jamaica. How is that even doable?
1. The temperature of stell ball is more consistent with water in 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. At 20 degrees Fahrenheit the water would be ice.
3. The temperature of stell ball is more consistent with water in 20 degrees Fahrenheit.

Here on Earth, a certain big animal prospers and lives happily. One day, a mystery disease that solely affects this unique species annihilates each and every one of these writers. They are all gone; there are none remaining everywhere on earth. They start to reappear on Earth again a year or so later. How is this possible?
1. The animal is the Mule. Since all Mules are born sterile, you can only get a Mule by crossing a donkey with a horse.
2. The animal is the dinosaur. Millions of years ago, dinosaurs roamed the Earth, but eventually, they became extinct due to various factors such as climate change or asteroid impact.
3. The animal is the butterfly. During the pupal stage of their life cycle, butterflies are inside a protective casing, and it may appear as if they have completely disappeared or been wiped out.

I excavate little caves and keep my gold and silver there. I also create gold crowns and silver bridges. They are the tiniest things you can imagine. Everyone will eventually require my assistance, but many people are reluctant to accept it. Why?
1. I am a dentist.
2. I am a theif.
3. I am a miner.

The brother of a beggar passed away, but the deceased had no brothers. How is that possible?
1. The man is angry for his brother being a beggar and cut ties with him.
2. The beggar was the man's sister.
3. The bagger's brother is a murderer.

Danny had just passed under an overpass in his semi when he abruptly came to a stop. Danny accidentally drove under the overpass that was only just tall enough for his truck because he wasn't paying enough attention. He was unable to move forward or backward in the semi due to how tightly it was wedged. When another tracker passed by, he was told how simple it would be to remove the semi from underneath the bridge. What did he recommend?
1. He told Danny to left the bridge.
2. He told Danny to overturn the track.
3. He told Danny to let some air out of his tires.

Why is Christmas Day so chilly?
1. Because it's in December.
2. Because people are waiting for the New Year.
3. Because people are celebrating.

A tower is jumped over by a horse, and the tower vanishes. It's not a dream or an illusion. So where might this occur?
1. On the moon.
2. On a chessboard.
3. Under the sea.

A boy had just finished getting ready for his prom, shaving, applying cologne, and there would be an after-party. His parents had told him to be home for the next sunrise, but he arrived with a full-grown beard instead. How is this possible?
1. He lives in Alaska and sunrise are every six months.
2. His beard grows in an amazing speed.
3. He went crazy with friends in that unnormal party.

A full water glass was in the hands of the magician. Without spilling a single drop of water, he held the glass above his head and allowed it to fall to the carpet. How did he accomplish dropping the glass from a height of six feet without any water spilling?
1. The glass is too heavy.
2. Surface tension prevents water from spilling.
3. The glass was filled, but not with water.

Apricot Jam was being made by Morgan. She stirred the apricots in the pot after adding them all. It was then that she realized she needed to add 1 ounce of lemon juice for every 2 apricots! How did she calculate the appropriate amount of lemon juice?
1. She is an execellent chef.
2. She is good at physicis.
3. She counted the pits of apricots.

Craig passed away there. Tracy passed away at sea shortly after. No one was sad; in fact, everyone was ecstatic. Why?
1. They were both hurricanes.
2. People are getting used to it.
3. It is a culture traditional.

Wednesday, Tom and Joe had dinner at a restaurant. After finishing, they paid and departed. Joe and Tom don't have to pay. Who paid the bill?
1. The restaurant is too expensive.
2. They found money in their hamburger.
3. Wednesday. The name of the third person in the group, not the day.

A woman who lives in New York legally wed three men; she didn't get divorced, enroll, or separate from them in any other way. How is that even possible?
1. His husband is not a good husband.
2. The woman is not a good person.
3. She is a minister.

There were two camels facing in different directions. One was facing directly East, and the other directly West. There was no reflection because they were in the desert. How do they manage to see one another without turning around, moving their heads, or moving around?
1. The two camels were facing each other the entire time. Hence facing in opposite directions.
2. They were in the middle of desert.
3. Their eyes have a very wide view.

Nolan is in front of a store. She is unable to read the signs, but she is aware that she must enter in order to make a purchase. Where in the store is she?
1. Fruit store.
2. Bakery.
3. Eye glasses store.

Without breaking the law, a truck driver went three blocks down a one-way street. Why is that?
1. There is no people on that street.
2. He tried to get away from the police.
3. The truck driver was walking.

A shooter put his hat away and donned a blindfold. He then made a 100-yard walk, turned around, and shot a bullet in the hat. The man's vision was completely obscured by the effective blindfold. How did he pull this off?
1. He hung his hat on the barrel of his gun.
2. He uses a computer to compute his actions.
3. He uses the sound to feel the direction.

When there was a severe power outage, George was on the eighth floor of an office building cleaning the windows. He had disabled the electric hoist on his platform. So how did he escape before the power was turned back on?
1. George walked down the stairs. He was cleaning the inside of the windows.
2. George get to the roof and escape.
3. George needs to lift a heavy object.

A woman took her young daughter with her when she went to see her bank manager. The bank manager permitted the woman's daughter to spend the meeting with his secretary. The secretary turned to the other secretary after the woman and her daughter left and told her, "That little girl was my daughter." How is that possible?
1. The girl has two mothers.
2. The gril's mother gets a promotion.
3. The secretary was the girl's father.

How is it possible for a man to have a long beard while sharing multiple times per day?
1. He's a barber.
2. He wants his girlfriend to buy him a razor.
3. The man's beard grows in a crazy speed.

Everyone called him "Batman," but he knew nothing about bats and thought they were disgusting. He still cherished being referred to as Batman! How is this possible?
1. He is afraid others will laugh at him.
2. He tries to be friendly.
3. He was the star baseball player.

A rancher shot once and killed all 500 of his cows. What was his secret?
1. A shotgun.
2. A panoramic photo.

3. A big pistol.

I departed my campsite and traveled 3 miles to the south. I then made an eastward turn and traveled 3 miles. After 3 miles of heading north, I turned around and saw a bear eating inside my tent! The bear was what color?
1. White.

2. Black.
3. Brown.

Juliana and Maria went out for drinks collectively. They placed a joint drink order. In the time it took Maria to finish one, Juliana, who was extremely thirsty, finished five. Only Maria perished despite the drinks being poisoned. How?
1. The poison was in the ice.
2. The poison is unfunctional when you drink them together.
3. The poison need time to dissolve.

A man and his dog are both standing on opposite sides of a river. The guy summons his dog, who quickly crosses the river without getting wet. There were no bridges or boats. What was the dog's secret?
1. The dog can dry off in a sudden.
2. The dog jumped half-mile far and get to the man.
3. The river was frozen.

A knock on the door is heard by the woman while she is seated in her hotel room. When she opens the door, she is greeted by a stranger. I'm sorry, I made a mistake; I thought this was my room, he apologizes. He then exits the elevator and walks down the hall. The woman returns to her room and makes a security call. What gave the woman cause to be so wary of the man?
1. The woman knows this man on the newspaper.
2. If he really thought it was his hotel room, he would have tried to open the door not knock on it first.

3. The woman thought the man is rude.

A guy is strolling down a rural way while wearing nothing but black. Unexpectedly, a big, dark automobile turns the corner without any lights on and stops abruptly. How did the driver of the automobile know that he was there?
1. The driver is good at listening.
2. The driver was paying much attention.
3. It was day time.

A man turns 25 and passes away from old age. How is that even possible?
1. His life is not worth living.
2. He was born on February 29th

3. The man is not healthy.

Why is the value of 1968 pennies higher than 1967 pennies?
1. Old money weight more than new money.
2. Old money is dirtier than new money.
3. Because there is one more penny in 1968 pennies than in 1967 pennies

A man gives a woman a $10 bill and pays her $3 for a rope. To get change, the woman enters the grocery store right next door. When she comes back, she gives the man $7. Hey, that was a counterfeit bill you gave me, the store clerk says as the customer leaves. The lady hands the cashier a decent bill. How much has she lost in total?
1. Seven dollars plus the rope.
2. Seven dollars.
3. Thirteen dollars.

Sally lives in an area with a warm summer for six months of the year and a harsh winter for the other six. She has a lake with a tiny island in it. She needs to transport supplies to the island since she wants to build a house there. She lacks a boat, an aircraft, or any other means of transportation to get them to the island. How does Sally deal with this issue?
1. She waits to take the materials over during the colder months because the lake will freeze over, so she can walk over it.

2. She borrows necessary materials from her neighborhood. Her neighborhood is rich and friendly.
3. She drives a plane to load all the material she needs to the island.

Some months' names contain eight letters, while others only contain five. Which month has three?
1. June.
2. They all do.
3. March.

It turns out that Sandy was being truthful when she said she had seen an ocean devoid of water. How is it even doable?

1. Sandy saw the ocean on a map.
2. Ocean is too cold that it freezes totally.
3. The whether is too hot that vaporates all water.

What was the most recent year when New Year's arrive before Christmas?
1. Last year.
2. 2000.0
3. This year.

When two moms and two daughters went out to dine, just three slices of pizza were consumed. What makes that possible?
1. One piece of pizza is enough for two girls.
2. The group included a grandmother, her daughter and her daughter's daughter.

3. One mother gave her pizza to two girls.

A cat was outside when it began to rain. Even though the cat was thoroughly saturated by the rain and had nowhere to hide from it, not a single hair was wet. How is this possible?
1. The cat succeeded in avoiding all rain drops.
2. The outside whether is changing frequently.
3. It was a hairless cat.

How did the young youngster kick his soccer ball 10 feet, and it miraculously returned to him?
1. The wind is so strong that the ball doesn't fly so far.
2. There is a rope between the ball and the boy.
3. He kicked it up.

Who would take office as president if the vice president passed away?
1. The speaker of the House.
2. The President.
3. The Cabinet members.

Mrs. Adams informs her next-door neighbor that her son is turning 16 today and will turn 20 on his next birthday. How is that possible?
1. He was born on February 29.

2. His life is not worth living.
3. The man is not healthy.

There is only one boat, yet only one person can fit on it. The river is pretty wide and rapid. Fortunately, they both get to south side of the river. How? 
1. One person already at the south side of the river.
2. One men go home to get a another boat.
3. They both jump to the south side.

Despite being in December, David's birthday is never in the winter. Why? 
1. His family will hold a huge celebration for him.
2. He lives in Australia.
3. He alwasy gets cold in winter.

Soccer was being played between two teams. Team One had a player score a hat trick (triple goal). Their comrades rejoiced greatly. However, after he scored the fourth goal, his teammates reprimanded him. How is this even conceivable?
1. His teammates is envy about him.
2. He should focus more on defense.
3. The player scored in their own goal.

8 brothers are present. Chess is being played by Brother 1. Brother 2 is chowing down. The third brother is playing video games. 4th Brother is jiving. Brother 5 is sending an SMS. Brother No. 6 is in class. Brother 7 is sound asleep. Who or what is Brother 8?
1. Brother 8 is sleeping.
2. Brother 8 is dancing.
3. Brother 8 is playing checkers.

On July 4, a girl traveled to the United States to party for three days before returning on July 4. How did she manage that?
1. The girl drank a lot and slept at party for 3 days.
2. She went over on the date of the 4th of July and came home on the boat called the July 4.
3. July 7th is holiday.

There was a farmer who wanted to go investigate a problem with his chicken coop. As soon as he arrived, he saw a rooster perched atop the barn. Now the barn had a top that resembled a triangle. However, the rooster unexpectedly laid an egg. How did it roll on that side?
1. It didn't because rosters don't lay eggs.
2.  There is a hole in the roof. Furthermore, the egg dropped into the hole.
3. It is possible the egg would roll down the middle of the triangle-shaped top of the barn.

A mom with four boys resides in London. Despite the fact that they are all doctors, none of them ever attended medical school. How is it even possible?
1. Woman's sons learned all their knowledge by themselves.
2. The woman's sons are all "doctors" in the academic sense 
3. Woman's sons are too busy to take courses in medical school.

The same parents gave birth to two girls at the same time on the same day in the same month, but they are not twins. Why is this even a possibility?
1. One girl ran away from home at a young age.
2. One gril has father's last name, one girl has mother's last name.
3. They were not born in the same year.

The entire single-story home is pink, including the outside. The windows, the top, and the doors are all pink. What are the stair's colors?
1. It should be pink as the whole house is in pink.
2. The stairs is uncolored as people always step on that.
3. There are no stairs in a single story house.

A girl fell into a 60-foot well after slipping, but she was unwet. How is it even possible?
1. The well is dry.
2. The well is too deep.
3. The water is too hot.

I planted a stone, and it sprouted leaves and fruit. How is that even possible?
1. The stone was actually a seed, not an ordinary stone. The seed of a cherry is called a stone.
2. The ground is close to a lake.
3. TUmNioAvy4g4yjtpm7NddBi9chAAB9RUep

A bus driver was driving along a Colorado roadway. He drove straight through a stop sign, turned left when there was a "no left turn" sign, and traveled the opposite way on a one-way street. He then drove on the left side of the road, passing a police cruiser. Nonetheless, he did not violate any traffic laws. So why not?
1. There was no police in that cop car.
2. He was walking.
3. He tried to get away from the police.

A pet store owner had a parrot with the sign "Parrot repeats everything it hears" on its cage. Davey bought the parrot and chatted to it for two weeks without it saying anything. He returned the parrot, but the shopkeeper said he had never lied about it. How is this possible?
1. The parrot was tired.
2. The parrot was deaf.
3. Davey was deaf.

In a pitch-black cave, three individuals are imprisoned. The first is terrified of total darkness, the second is terrified of bats, and the third is terrified of becoming lost. They lack any form of light source, including flashlights, lanterns, and mobile phones, which they cannot use as a light source since they have no signal. How are they going to escape the cave?
1. They run over around the whole cave and find the way out.
2. They can just walk out as it's daytime outside the cave.
3. They try to run away from the bat.

Although they were born on the same day of the same month, two students who go to the same school and share a teacher are not related. How is this even conceivable?
1. They were not born in the same year.
2. One student ran away from home at a young age.
3. One student had a bad academic grades and broken up with his parents.

Walking along the seashore is a man. Without turning around, he is surprised to see his own footstep clearly. How is that even doable?
1. He is walking backward.
2. The footstep will move all over around with water.
3. The reflection by the sea let him saw the footsetp.

In a home where he resided, the man always lit the room before bed. The man neglected to switch on the light one evening. He read the newspaper the following day and sinking into deep self-blame. Why? 
1. The man is a world-renowned botanist moved into a rare greenhouse.
2. The man is a calendar maker.
3. The man lived in a lighthouse. He forgot to turn on the light and a ship crashed.

One day, two dads and two sons went fishing. They were there all day and barely caught three fish. One father stated, "That is enough for all of us; we will each have one." How is this possible?
1. Two sons shared the same fish.
2. There was the father, his son, and his son's son.
3. One father gave his fish to his son.

How can you stand physically behind your friend while he stands physically behind you?
1. By standing back to back.
2. By standing stand upside down.
3. With the help of optical illusions.

Some months have 30 days, while others have 31. How many people have 28?
1. They all do.
2. One, February.
3. Two, the first and end month of the year.

How can you leave a room with two legs and return with six legs?
1. Bring another man back with you.
2. Bring a chair back with you.
3. You're walking back upside down.

Two police officers entered a room without any windows and discovered a dead man who had apparently hung himself from the ceiling, though they were unable to determine how. There was no table or chair beneath him from which he could have jumped. merely a water paddle. What was his method?
1. He stood on a block of ice until it melted.
2. The man sat on the floor.
3. He positioned himself.

There was no power in town, and none of the street lights or traffic signals worked. A dark limousine sped down the recently laid blacktop, headlights turned off. A little youngster in complete black (no reflectors) went out to cross the roadway. Despite the fact that the moon was not out and the youngster had no flashlight, the motorist stopped to let the boy to cross the street. How did the driver notice the youngster?
1. The driver was good at listening.
2. The driver was paying much attention on the road.
3. The driver saw the boy because it was during the daylight hours.

A guy was just going about his business when his suit was ripped. Why did he pass away three minutes later?
1. He was an astronaut on a space walk, doing repairs.
2. His suit was so expensive that he couldn't afford to buy a new one.
3. He never ruin clothes before. His heart couldn't handle the stress, leading to his unfortunate demise.

Four automobiles, each approaching from a separate direction, arrive to a four-way stop. They can't decide who arrived first, so they all proceed at the same time. They do not collide, but all four automobiles are destroyed. What makes this possible?
1. Their cars have different heights that can drive beyond each other.
2. They decided to drive reversely with their rears forward first.
3. They all made right-hand turns.

A man is late for an appointment and takes a bend so quickly that just two wheels are on the pavement. A cop is waiting on the corner, but he hasn't issued him a ticket. Why?
1. The policeman was superised by his driving skill.
2. The two car wheels was large enough to support the him.
3. He was on a motorcycle.

Four men sat down to play, and they played all night until the sun came up. They played for gold, not for pleasure, with individual scores for everyone. They had all earned good money when it came to square accounts. Can you explain the paradox: If no one loses, how can everyone win?
1. The men were miners..
2. The men were musicians..
3. The men were pokers..

Imagine Johnny, a party clown, is clutching three gold coins, each weighing one kilogram. While walking, he comes upon a bridge with a sign stating that it can only handle a maximum of 80 kilos. The gold weighs three kilos and John weighs 78 pounds. Johnny reads the notice and crosses the bridge safely with all of the riches. How did he pull it off?
1. Johnny is a clown so he has mastered juggling. When he came to the bridge he judged the gold, always keeping one piece in the air.
2. Johnny burried one gold in the start of the bridge and make sure the location is private enough that no one can find.
3. Johnny sank the gold to the bottom of the river and left a mark so that he could find it later.

In 1898, a guy was born. He is still living at the age of 33.  How is this even possible?
1. He never celebrate his birthday after 33 years old.
2. he was born in room 1898 in the hospital.
3. His birthday is February 29th, which is celebrated every four years.
